div.a: One Chart That Explains Why Apple Is Now A Broken Stock

div.div: A key reason Apple is a broken stock is because of something Apple didn’t say.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V4ECqr&via=Digg&text=One Chart That Explains Why Apple Is Now A Broken Stock

div.div: One of the common misconceptions about field work is that working and living in the polar regions has to be incredibly harsh and unforgiving. Personal expectation and flexibility, as well as preparedness and training, make the difference between living in a comfortable camp or a miserable death trap.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wxjusz&via=Digg&text=Roughing It, Antarctic Style

div.a: Did Michelin Drive This Chef To His Death?

div.div: When famed French chef Bernard Loiseau shot himself in the head in his bedroom with a hunting rifle in 2003, the culinary set wept over losing one of the world’s greatest chefs—and then almost immediately blamed two top gastronomic authorities, Gault&Millau and Michelin, for pushing him over the brink.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10GrOXM&via=Digg&text=Did Michelin Drive This Chef To His Death?

div.a: The Lab Accident That Led To The Discovery Of Supertasters

div.div: A cloud of chemicals. One researcher detects a smell. The other does not. What happens next? Science.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WW06VT&via=Digg&text=The Lab Accident That Led To The Discovery Of Supertasters

div.a: People Are Handcuffing Escaped Crocodiles In South Africa

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W8qyxk&via=Digg&text=People Are Handcuffing Escaped Crocodiles In South Africa

div.a: Science Creates The World’s First Alcoholism Vaccine

div.div: Scientists in Chile have spent the past year designing a drug that will give anyone who drinks alcohol an immediate (and very nasty) hangover.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W50LqL&via=Digg&text=Science Creates The World’s First Alcoholism Vaccine

div.a: 2 Babies In 9 Months? The Facts On Pregnancy Spacing

div.div: Two babies in Britain are definitely Irish twins — they were born to one mother just nine months apart, and will be in the same year at school, according to the Daily Telegraph.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14iU5az&via=Digg&text=2 Babies In 9 Months? The Facts On Pregnancy Spacing

div.div: How squid scientists captured the Kraken on film.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XBfw09&via=Digg&text=To Catch A Giant Predator

div.a: Shirley Temple Joins Twitter, Is Immediately Asked For Her Thoughts On Honey Boo Boo

div.div: With direct access to one of most iconic thespians to ever pose for celluloid during Hollywood's Golden Age, the thoughts of Twitter users immediately turned to a single question: What does Shirley Temple think of America's latest little sweetheart, Honey Boo Boo.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V4M7xB&via=Digg&text=Shirley Temple Joins Twitter, Is Immediately Asked For Her Thoughts On Honey Boo Boo

div.a: Detailed Photos Of Cold War Missile Sites

div.div: The idea that we are not so different from our enemies is one of the undercurrents of Justin Barton‘s photographs.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TqK0ai&via=Digg&text=Detailed Photos Of Cold War Missile Sites

div.a: Subway Apologizes For Failing To 'Fully Deliver' On Footlong Promise

div.div: It's been a rough week for Subway.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W7XGFF&via=Digg&text=Subway Apologizes For Failing To 'Fully Deliver' On Footlong Promise

div.div: A French government commission responsible for protecting the French language from anglicisms has forbidden the Twitter term "hashtag" from all official correspondence.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UqqV69&via=Digg&text=France Is Renaming 'Hashtag'

div.a: Square COO Keith Rabois Quits After Sexual Harassment Allegations

div.div: Mr. Rabois is a member of the storied PayPal mafia, having worked at both PayPal and LinkedIn prior to Square.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V5ozZG&via=Digg&text=Square COO Keith Rabois Quits After Sexual Harassment Allegations

div.a: A Brief History Of Dolphins Turning Up In New York City

div.div: The Gowanus dolphin is not the first dolphin to make its way to New York.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y4zbZj&via=Digg&text=A Brief History Of Dolphins Turning Up In New York City

div.div: Contrary to popular belief, the parking meter was originally designed to keep traffic moving and make more spaces available for shoppers, a measure often lauded by local businesses as much as the public who paid their hourly rates.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11XcU4n&via=Digg&text=The History Of Parking Meters

div.a: How I Turned Instagram Into A Dating Service

div.div: He'd been following me on Instagram for months — we had good friends in common though I'd never seen him before. I followed him back. A week later he wrote “Come see me sometime?”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XFdRYi&via=Digg&text=How I Turned Instagram Into A Dating Service

div.a: Stephen King: My Work Is A 'Possible Accelerant' To Killers

div.div: As one of the most popular authors in the world, King is immediately a powerful new presence in the gun control debate.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WVDh4M&via=Digg&text=Stephen King: My Work Is A 'Possible Accelerant' To Killers

div.a: Science Proves Whether The Chicken Or The Egg Came First

div.div: After watching ASAP Science definitively answer the question of which came first—the chicken or the egg—I can now sleep in peace.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W4krKq&via=Digg&text=Science Proves Whether The Chicken Or The Egg Came First

div.a: Apple Is No Longer The World's Most Valuable Company

div.div: Exxon used to be America's most valuable company by market capitalization until it was displaced by Apple, and now in the wake of Apple's "disappointing" earnings report they've ended up neck-in-both both at around $415 billion with the exact numbers changing every minute.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WVVWgH&via=Digg&text=Apple Is No Longer The World's Most Valuable Company

div.a: Tracking The Travel Patterns Of Secretaries Of State

div.div: Outgoing Secretary of State Hillary Clinton, it is often said, has visited more countries than any predecessor. But the picture is more complicated than that, as this great interactive demonstrates.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14d5x8D&via=Digg&text=Tracking The Travel Patterns Of Secretaries Of State

div.div: When it comes to publicity moves, a secret marriage is perhaps the most brilliant: You appear as if you’re avoiding publicity at the very moment you double interest in the event.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V5lu9W&via=Digg&text=A Century Of Hollywood Publicity

div.div: LEAVE IT TO THE PROFESSIONAL JUGGLERS

div.a: If You Think You're Good At Multitasking, You Probably Aren't

div.div: So many of us think we're multitasking ninjas, while the rest of the people nattering away while driving are idiots. But scientists say that the better people think they are at multitasking, the worse they really are at juggling.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W2lMRS&via=Digg&text=If You Think You're Good At Multitasking, You Probably Aren't

div.a: How To Privately Share A Vine Video

div.div: You have been warned: nothing you share on Twitter's new video sharing app Vine is private. Here's how you can work around that.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WVN5M4&via=Digg&text=How To Privately Share A Vine Video

div.div: YOU'LL WISH YOU HAD THE FLU

div.a: Forget The Flu: The Norovirus Is Taking Over America

div.div: Just when it seemed like this year's flu epidemic was finally under control, along comes the CDC with a new plague that's sweeping the nation: the norovirus.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W6Bzzc&via=Digg&text=Forget The Flu: The Norovirus Is Taking Over America

div.a: Hollywood So Desperate For Ideas It's Making Movies Based On Deviant Art Drawings

div.div: Hollywood has long taken its plot cues from the Internet, but whatever nepotistic intern tasked with trawling the web for script ideas this time has truly outdone himself.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Uns0vz&via=Digg&text=Hollywood So Desperate For Ideas It's Making Movies Based On Deviant Art Drawings

div.a: The Terrible Truth About Cats And Dogs

div.div: I would like to control a dog some day, but right now I have a cat, and the cat craps in a box full of stuff for cats to crap on.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W3pc6X&via=Digg&text=The Terrible Truth About Cats And Dogs

div.a: Hi, I'm The Gaming Industry, And I'm Addicted To Vaporware

div.div: It’s time for the game industry, and maybe some of its customers, to admit they have a vaporware problem.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W6dt7O&via=Digg&text=Hi, I'm The Gaming Industry, And I'm Addicted To Vaporware

div.a: 12 Piano Notes Made Visible For The First Time

div.div: For the first time in history individual piano notes have been made visible using the CymaScope instrument.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/u9MLeI&via=Digg&text=12 Piano Notes Made Visible For The First Time

div.a: A Drug That Can Make Sleep Optional

div.div: Who benefits from a society that wants to regulate or govern alertness?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vap3f4&via=Digg&text=A Drug That Can Make Sleep Optional

div.div: A SUBWAY HERO BIGGER THAN 11 INCHES

div.a: Subway Hero Lifted Giant Drunk Man Off The Tracks Just In Time

div.div: When army veteran and Harlem cab driver Isidore Branham saw a drunk man passed out on the tracks, it triggered his dormant hero tendencies. "My instincts just came alive."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W7beRA&via=Digg&text=Subway Hero Lifted Giant Drunk Man Off The Tracks Just In Time

div.div: On Tuesday night, a huge vacant warehouse on Chicago's South Side went up in flames. Complicating the scene was the weather -- temperatures were well below freezing and the spray from the fire hoses encased everything below in ice, including buildings, vehicles, and some firefighting gear.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14dCyAr&via=Digg&text=Chicago's Freezing Fire In Pictures

div.a: The 25 Best Cocktails In NYC Right Now, In GIFs

div.div: The key to crafting a great cocktail lies in the tiniest of details. The precise placement of a single leaf of mint, carefully hand-sifting one layer of liquor from another, muddling with fervor (but not too feverishly): These are the things that elevate a simple concoction to something truly special.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14hEFmS&via=Digg&text=The 25 Best Cocktails In NYC Right Now, In GIFs

div.div: Some of his friends and teammates remember Anthony Wayne Smith as a strange and volatile guy, prone to paranoia and outrageous lies. Others recall a gentle giant who gave to charity and mentored kids. None would have predicted that he'd retire from football to a life of arson, torture, and murder—but that's exactly what prosecutors allege.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SG6ank&via=Digg&text=Raider. QB Crusher. Murderer?
